examples.text: As a defensive measure he built a series of coastal forts and watchtowers.
Troops took up a defensive position around the town.

definitions.definition: behaving in a way that shows that you feel that people are criticizing you

examples.text: Don't ask him about his plans—he just gets defensive.
He is extremely defensive about his work.
Her manner was oddly defensive, as he hadn't intended any criticism at all.
Whenever anyone mentions women's rights, he gets rather defensive.

definitions.definition: connected with trying to prevent the other team or player from scoring points or goals

wordOrigin: late Middle English: from Old French défensif, -ive, from medieval Latin defensivus, from Latin defens- ‘warded off’, from the verb defendere, from de- ‘off’ + -fendere ‘to strike’.
